rev.comment: undid POV fighting and personal conf
Removed refrences to paraphernalia do to their un-neutral connontations. Tools is effective enough of a word to get the point across more neutrally. - Also removed drug refrences in lieu of "other"
Date/fix the maintenance tags or gen fixes using [[Project:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
/* Smoking in culture */ proposed move of section
Source is still biased, and information is presented as fact (undid per wiki standards)
revert; the source is the book smoke, not anti-smoking pages
Undid- No it's not proven. Most of those studies are either unscientific or misinterpreted. Do some real reasearch on the issue and you'll see. (Don't use anit-smoking pages for resources)
that smoking is hazardous to your health is well-proven and completele
merged previous version to include information deleted by anti-smokers - removed improprer links
revert to version by [[User:Peter Isotalo|Peter Isotalo]] of 13:16, 21 September 2007 (159383769)

/* Headline text[[Link title]]SMOKING IS BAD MORE THAN 1,000,000 PEOPLE DIE FROM IT EVERY YEAR. EVERY TIME YOU SMOKE IT TAKES OF 3 MINUTES OF YOU LIFE!!! SMOKING CAUSES LUNG CANCER AND BLACK LUNGS. STOP SMOKING. */
/* Smoking makes you fat....FactYou are a fat obese gay if ure reading this page */

I re-worded the paragraph for accuracy. Methamphetamines and cocaine are technically not narcotics, and cannibis is more intoxicating (though less toxic) than either of those drugs and salvia.

Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/124.178.161.9|124.178.161.9]] to last version by Peter Isotalo
/* South Asia */ restored removal of dating; these facts are referenced by the chapter in "Smoke"
/* South Asia */ Vedas hard to date. Dates of the Vedas were literally "guessed" in the last century, never took into account oral transmission, Hindus rewrote texts with changing times.
the skull is better representative of the rising popularity of the cigarette; started film section; tweaked Bogart caption since "bogarting" isn't exclusive to cannabis users
Spent the last hour looking for images before realizing no discussion of smoking and film would be complete without Bogart.
Unprotected Smoking: two users engaged in minor revert war, does not merit full protection; 3RR blocks can be issued if necessary
Protected Smoking: both users did 4R, protection is better option [edit=sysop:move=sysop]
revert; discuss this instead of just throwing your personal opinions around
the man is not even smoking the pipe, maybe he is distracted by the infant hygiene exercise in the foreground... surely the readers are also; I know I am.
the pipe ([[René Magritte|if indeed that's what it is]]) is barely visible and obviously not the focal point of the painting. write about the [[History of diapers]] if you'd like to use it.
please read the addition to the text; it's not a coincidence that it's included in an anthology about smoking and that there's a pipe in the picture
this painting (which shows a woman wiping a child's ass and a man about to get sick) is a manifestly poor illustration of your concept, as it has nothing to do with smoking
/* Art */ hrrm... I was sure I had included it...
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 148097372 by [[Special:Contributions/Magnus animum|Magnus animum]] ([[User talk:Magnus animum|talk]])
Rvt. He's more likely to be grimacing at the stench of the baby than any non-existant smoke in the painting
revert; the painting represents the sense of smell, with which smoking was associated and this is explained in the text
man is grimacing, holding nose for reasons/odors unrelated to smoking. rm confusing image.

rev.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/Jimbo1986|Jimbo1986]] ([[User talk:Jimbo1986|talk]]) to last version by Peter Isotalo
revert most of new anti-smoking wording
Tone down tobacco marketing tone of initial paragraphs
Reverted 1 edit by [[Special:Contributions/12.215.124.71|12.215.124.71]] identified as [[WP:VAND|vandalism]] to last revision by [[User:Peter Isotalo|Peter Isotalo]]. using [[WP:TWINKLE|TW]]
/* History */ more on the tobacco revolution, East Asia
Date/fix the maintenance tags or gen fixes
/* Europe */ replaced image with something more colorful and layout-friendly
/* Sub-Saharan Africa */ tobacco and cannabis was => tobacco and cannabis were
reinstated 1/3 of adult population-figure and moved ref for over one billion to "Social effects"
placed substances and tools next to each other, formatting, copyediting, linking
/* Sub-Saharan Africa */ added note to Bena Diemba info
/* Sub-Saharan Africa */ restore info on Bena Diemba; Google doesn't have info on everything
/* Public health and crime */ exactly why tobacco is not illegal is a bit more complex, I think
switch to shorthand notes under "Notes" with full details on sources in "Sources"
/* References */ these are more accurately notes, not just references
the fact is as referenced as the rest of the section, namely at the end; revert Common Era (no style wars, please)
/* Public health and crime */ removed OR
/* Sub-Saharan Africa */ returned reference, since there is none for that fact
/* Smoking substances */ Slight clarification; old text seemed clumsy.
removed NPOV-tag until someone actually specifies how the article is partial
/* Social effects */ has anyone actually tried reading hthe sources provided before smearing fact tags all over the place?; *the entire section* is referenced with Hilton
/* Sub-Saharan Africa */ "Smoke" is already cited (with greater precision) at the end of that very short paragraph
/* South Asia */ please don't add fact tags when there's a citation just a few sentences down the line
/* History */ it's cited in the next paragraph for crying out loud...
BCE -> BC; the dating format was established when the article was
deleted duplication of statement and moved ref
/* Art */ the section is sourced, so please check that source before questioning claims
"overview" is the same as the lead
/* Smoking substances */ corrected substance usage, refined sentence
/* Physiology */ helps put it in perspective
/* Smoking substances */ There are also psychedelics
/* Smoking substances */ Marijuana is not a narcotic.
/* History */ wikipedia implies Israelite is better than Hebrew. but 'jewish' is problematic (see israelite entry)
/* History */ Jewish Israelites? who says that?
Doesn't convey any new / useful information, adds clutter.
restore NPOV dispute tag, please contribute to the discussion.
/* South Asia */ the reason why kretek are so popular...
Google gets one hit for "Bena Diemba." I'm removing this as potential complete bollocks, with apologies to whoever added it.
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/200.158.204.63|200.158.204.63]] ([[User talk:200.158.204.63|talk]]) to last version by Freakofnurture
/* South Asia */ added ref, changed number
/* Sub-Saharan Africa */ added ref regarding Tabwa, removed fact tag
/* Sub-Saharan Africa */ ref added about sub-saharan africa, fact tag removed
/* History */ added reference to shamanism and smoking, removed fact tag
added reference, removed fact tags associated with newly referenced statements
fix incorrect link to [[water pipe]] in intro. Refer instead to bong and hookah
PCP is NOT a narcotic by its very definition!
/* Public health and crime */ - style correction
The 1st sentence of the 2nd paragraph said "one of the most common form of recreational..." I added an "s" to make it plural.
Typos and removed a link (that was linked earlier in the article)
/* Physiology */ removed a first before toke because there were two
/* Literature */ fixed heading and added content
/* Smoking tools and paraphernalia */ the paraphernalia
/* Smoking tools and paraphanlia */ corrected spelling and grammar
added "Smoking in culture", "Social effects", revamped sections on smoking substances and equipment
corrected footnotes, added sections on physiology and health effects, Sub-Saharan Africa and 19th century opium smoking
so let's get this article started for real; a lot more to come
moved [[Smoking]] to [[Smoking (disambiguation)]]: making an article here
